chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall P : Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall x1 x2 : Z, 0 <= x1 -> 0 <= x2 -> P x1 x2 -> exists y1 y2 : Z, 0 <= y1 /\ 0 <= y2 /\ Z.add y1 y2 < Z.add x1 x2 /\ P y1 y2) -> forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> ~ P x y

Premises:
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Zlt_0_rec : forall P : Z -> Type, (forall x : Z, (forall y : Z, 0 <= y < x -> P y) -> 0 <= x -> P x) -> forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> P x
Z.bi_induction : forall P : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful Z.eq iff) P -> P 0 -> (forall x : Z, P x <-> P (Z.succ x)) -> forall z : Z, P z
well_founded_induction_type : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Type, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
fast_Zred_factor4 : forall (x y z : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * (y + z)) -> P (x * y + x * z)
fast_Zred_factor2 : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * (1 + y)) -> P (x + x * y)
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
fast_Zred_factor3 : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * (1 + y)) -> P (x * y + x)
fast_Zred_factor6 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x + 0) -> P x
fast_Zplus_comm : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (y + x) -> P (x + y)
Z.le_0_mul : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n * m -> 0 <= n /\ 0 <= m \/ n <= 0 /\ m <= 0
well_founded_lt_compat : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (R : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> (f x < f y)%nat) -> well_founded R
Zdiv_rest_proofs_rect : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (P : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (e : x = q * two_power_pos p + r) (l : 0 <= r) (l0 : r < two_power_pos p), P (Zdiv_rest_proof x p q r e l l0)) -> forall z : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p, P z
Zdiv_rest_proofs_sind : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (P : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (e : x = q * two_power_pos p + r) (l : 0 <= r) (l0 : r < two_power_pos p), P (Zdiv_rest_proof x p q r e l l0)) -> forall z : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p, P z
Zdiv_rest_proofs_ind : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (P : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (e : x = q * two_power_pos p + r) (l : 0 <= r) (l0 : r < two_power_pos p), P (Zdiv_rest_proof x p q r e l l0)) -> forall z : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p, P z
fast_OMEGA14 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2) -> P (v * Z.neg x + l1 + (v * Z.pos x + l2))
fast_OMEGA13 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2) -> P (v * Z.pos x + l1 + (v * Z.neg x + l2))

Zdiv_mod_unique : forall b q1 q2 r1 r2 : Z, 0 <= r1 < Z.abs b -> 0 <= r2 < Z.abs b -> b * q1 + r1 = b * q2 + r2 -> q1 = q2 /\ r1 = r2
Z.quot_rem_unique : forall b q1 q2 r1 r2 : Z, 0 <= r1 < b \/ b < r1 <= 0 -> 0 <= r2 < b \/ b < r2 <= 0 -> b * q1 + r1 = b * q2 + r2 -> q1 = q2 /\ r1 = r2
Z.div_mod_unique : forall b q1 q2 r1 r2 : Z, 0 <= r1 < b \/ b < r1 <= 0 -> 0 <= r2 < b \/ b < r2 <= 0 -> b * q1 + r1 = b * q2 + r2 -> q1 = q2 /\ r1 = r2
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.sqrtrem_spec : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> let (s, r) := Z.sqrtrem n in n = s * s + r /\ 0 <= r <= 2 * s
fast_Zplus_assoc : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + m + p) -> P (n + (m + p))
fast_Zplus_permute : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (m + (n + p)) -> P (n + (m + p))
fast_Zplus_assoc_reverse : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + (m + p)) -> P (n + m + p)
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.add_pos_nonneg : forall n m : Z, 0 < n -> 0 <= m -> 0 < n + m

```coq
intros P H x y Hx Hy.
revert x y Hx Hy.
apply Zlt_0_rec.
intros z IH1 x0 IH2 Hx Hy HP.
destruct (H x0 y Hx Hy HP) as [y1 [y2 [Hy1 [Hy2 [Hlt HP']]]]].
lapply (IH1 y1); [clear IH1 | lia].
intros Hy1_false.
apply Hy1_false.
exact Hy1.
```

original: intros P H x y Hx Hy. revert x y Hx Hy. apply Zlt_0_rec. intros z IH1 x0 IH2 Hx Hy HP. destruct (H x0 y Hx Hy HP) as [y1 [y2 [Hy1 [Hy2 [Hlt HP']]]]]. lapply (IH1 y1); [clear IH1 | lia]. intros Hy1_false. apply Hy1_false. apply Hy1.
